snippet: Republicans use the filibuster to deny a vote on Chuck Hagel, President Obama’s nominee to lead the Pentagon.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Republicans for using power of filibuster to block vote on Chuck Hagel; argues procedure was merely excuse to deny Pres Obama his nominee for defense secretary for as long as possible; laments that Harry Reid did not agree to Senate proposal to restore power of majority, which would reduce this type of filibuster abuse.
lead_paragraph: Republicans use the filibuster to deny a vote on Chuck Hagel, President Obama’s nominee to lead the Pentagon.

headline.seo: A Defense Secretary, Blocked by Politics
